alert.note: Alert for Howard; Merrick; Sherman (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 10 at 3:31PM CDT until April 10 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning Continues This Evening, Red Flag Warning in Effect for Monday, and a Fire Weather Watch is in Effect on Tuesday... ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 046, 047 AND 048... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM CDT MONDAY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 046, 047 AND 048... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 046, 047 AND 048... * AFFECTED AREA...In Nebraska, Fire Weather Zone 046 Sherman, Fire Weather Zone 047 Howard and Fire Weather Zone 048 Merrick. * WINDS...For today, northwest winds 20 to 30 MPH with gusts to 40 MPH. On Monday, south winds 15 to 20 MPH with gusts to 30 MPH. And on Tuesday, southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 14 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite may spread rapidly and exhibit extreme fire behavior. Use extreme caution if engaging in activities that could result in fire ignition.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
